info.title: IVCAP
info.description: **IVCAP** is for **service providers** to **offer** analytics **services** and for **consumers** to **order** customised **products** produced by said services. ### Typical Workflow 1. Obtain an token from the ID Providers listed in the document returned by [/1/authinfo.yaml](/1/authinfo.yaml). The token needs to be added as a bearer token via the Authorization header to every request to this service. 1. List all available service. 1. Select appropriate service and retrieve details, like parameters via Read Service. 1. Create the appropriate json request and POST it to Create Order. (see the example in the service description.) 1. The reply from the above POST operation contains a link (links/self) to the newly create order record accessible via Read Order. 1. Progress of the order fulfillment can be tracked via repeated calls to Read Order and the returned status. 1. Any information products created in the context of an order will be listed under producs which also include a link to the respective Read Artifact. 1. The Read Artifact service will return more details for each artifact, including a data link through which the artifact content can be downloaded. (The download link is also included in the products list returned by the Read Order service ). Please note that all schemas in this API are following the [{json:api}](https://jsonapi.org/) specs wherever appropriate. ### High-level Architecture On receiving an order through this **API**, the internal *Order Dispatcher* is creating a *workflow*, dispatching that to the [Argo workflow engine](https://argoproj.github.io/argo-workflows/) and create appropriate records in [Magda](https://magda.io/). As the execution of the workflow progresses, appropriate updates are posted to the order record in Magda, such as data accessed or produced. In addition, any information products created will be stored via [Minio](https://min.io/) in a deployment specific object store and made accessible through the *Artifact* service.

servers.description: This endpoint hosts all the IVCAP services.

parameters.description:
The $limit system query option requests the number of items in the queried
				collection to be included in the result.

parameters.description:
The content of 'page' is returned in the 'links' part of a previous query and
				will when set, ALL other parameters, except for 'limit' are ignored.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
The 'filter' system query option allows clients to filter a collection of
				resources that are addressed by a request URL. The expression specified with 'filter'
				is evaluated for each resource in the collection, and only items where the expression
				evaluates to true are included in the response.

				is evaluated for each resource in the collection, and only items where the expression

parameters.name: order-by
parameters.description:
The 'orderby' query option allows clients to request resources in either
				ascending order using asc or descending order using desc. If asc or desc not specified,
				then the resources will be ordered in ascending order. The request below orders Trips on
				property EndsAt in descending order.

Revoke a record for the same entity and same schema and create new one
			with the provided properties. __NOTE__, this method will fail if there is more than one active record for the entity/schema pair.

argo.description: Defines the workflow using argo's WF schema

opts.description: Type specific options - left for backward compatibility, if possible use type specific elements
opts.example: Illo dolores inventore odit unde architecto quis.

WorkflowT.description:
Defines the workflow to use to execute this service. Currently supported 'types' are 'basic'
	and 'argo'. In case of 'basic', use the 'basic' element for further parameters. In the current implementation
	'opts' is expected to contain the same schema as 'basic'

jwt_header_Authorization.description: Secures endpoint by requiring a valid JWT token
